remarks: Define a function generating the real Euclidean spaces of finite dimension.  The case ` n = 0 ` corresponds to a space of dimension 0, that is, limited to a neutral element.  Members of this family of spaces are Hilbert spaces, as shown in - ehlhl .  (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 16-Jun-2019.)
statement: df-ehl $p |- EEhil = ( n e. NN0 |-> ( RR^ ` ( 1 ... n ) ) ) $.
